page.title: 14THE WARREN-OUTDOOR PURSUITS
page.content: The redundant school building of the Stifford County Primary School has been sold by the County Council to the Thurrock Borough Council.The former Headteacher's house has been converted into a residential hostel with good kitchen, dormitory and study facilities.The playing field has been made into a camp site.Half of the school building remains which is being remodelled as an indoor activity centre. Local youth groups and schools can book the centre using it as a base for environmental studies,sailing,climbing and walking.The centre is run by a management committee formed from representatives of local school and youth groups. The first International Youth camp was held in August 1985.
